intro: Cnestis macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered cnestis, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. Cnestis macrantha is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories and along stream banks.
